Recent research in predictive maintenance (PdM) highlights the integration of explainable AI (XAI) to enhance human-machine collaboration and trust (Gama et al., 2023; Wellsandt et al., 2022). Key challenges include optimizing human-machine interfaces, addressing ethical concerns, and improving natural language processing (Ucar et al., 2024; Wellsandt et al., 2022). The automotive industry faces unique challenges in implementing ML-based PdM, including the need for public datasets and efficient deep learning methods (Theissler et al., 2021). Human-centric approaches emphasize the importance of trust, control, and organizational factors in PdM adoption (van Oudenhoven et al., 2022). Novel techniques incorporate domain expert feedback and simulate large-scale PdM scenarios (Nikitin & Kaski, 2022). XAI methods such as LIME, SHAP, PDP, and ICE are being applied to interpret AI models in rotating machine maintenance (Gawde et al., 2024). Overall, XAI in PdM offers new insights for addressing critical maintenance issues and improving decision-making processes (Sharma et al., 2023).
